title: Preparing for Typhoon Hagibis: Rugby far from the mind of Tokyo residents as memories stirred of previous storm devastation
text:
Commuting in Tokyo is generally a courteous business, but during Friday's rush hour there was an edge in the air. Passengers skittered along platforms, bundling on to the trains, using whatever means necessary to ensure a space on board – including, for one elderly gentleman, the tip of his umbrella.

The reason for the disquiet was the approach of Typhoon Hagibis, still skulking its way towards the Japanese capital and likely to make landfall today.
